name: Yellowscott Country Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second time staying at Yellowscott. A last-minute booking meant that the 3 bedroom Benarty 11 lodge was the only one available, but we were given a fairly substantial discount due to the fact that it was only my wife and I staying.
reviews.title: Another great stay
Chill time
reviews.text: The lodge was very clean and the living room/dining room/kitchen a good size. The main double bedroom was a little on the small side, and I wonder if the huge, empty cupboard which occupied around 25% of the room could perhaps have been put to better use? However the 2 single rooms looked to be a good size, and the double bed was very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight, of course, was the hot tub, which was lovely and warm with great views south over the hills and towards the bright lights of Grangemouth.
reviews.title: first visit to yellowscott!!

reviews.text: The lodges are a 35 minute car journey away from St Andrews, and only around 25 minutes from Edinburgh and Stirling, so provide a great base for exploring this part of the world. However the lodges and hot tub are so comfortable and relaxing that you may not want to head out anywhere. The 10/11 lodges currently built look close together, but you definitely have your privacy.
reviews.title: Little bit of paradise in fife

reviews.text: Been to Yellowscott a good few times now but we stayed in Benarty lodge this time, lovely and brand new in jan. the peace and quiet is great, lovely to chill in the hot tub and in this one the view is across the fields.
reviews.title: Second Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Yellowscott by chance in 2010 and stayed there for our Wedding Anniversary. We found the cabin beautifully decorated with lots of little finishing touches that just made it feel so lovely! It wasn't just looks though, it was very clean and modern and had everything we needed! They had even thought to provide tea/coffee, washing up liquid and a cloth and a selection of takeaway menus from places who knew where we were!
reviews.title: Our hideaway of choice - everytime!

reviews.text: The location is secluded with fantastic views but only half an hours drive from Edinburgh! (The Park and Ride's are so easy to find and brilliant bus services into and around the city!).
reviews.title: absolutely stunning..amazing staff who do anything to help you...10/10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You must stop at the Forth Road Bridge Cafe at South Queensferry! Their fresh cream meringues are the stuff dreams are made of (well, mine anyway!) and a coffee on their sofas is a great way to spend a little time...
reviews.title: fantastic luxury break

reviews.text: As for Yellowscott - its an annual pilgrimage now, we have been every year since! It's our perfect choice of hideaway with just the right access to the world!
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect !

reviews.text: stayed in ochil 8 for three nights.. absolute bliss would recommend no end to people!!! you have to go the hot tub is beautiful with candles at night and the lodges are such luxury.. very clean..the level of service here is second to none and staff bend over backwards to ensure that you have a great time...I will definitely be returning x
reviews.title: Perfect romantic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been here 4 times now so that's shows its good!
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in 3 different lodges, all of which have been lovely and adequate. There is nothing really to do on site but that's why we love it - you can just relax and recharge.
reviews.title: 1st Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are all really comfy and the hot tubs are fab! The colder the weather the better!
reviews.title: Beautiful relaxing lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lynne has always been lovely and helpful anytime we needed her.
reviews.title: Very relaxing :-D

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be back again!
reviews.title: Brilliant for chilling out !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in lomond 4 and had a fantastic time away. Highly recommended. The accomodation was spacious and cosy. Hot tub was fantastic (even in the snow). Super king bed was super comfy. Relaxation chair was also fantastic. Cannot wait to go back. Thank you yellowscott.
reviews.title: Relaxing wee holiday in cosy romantic lodge.

reviews.text: We had an amazing chilled weekend at yellowscot cabins. Cabin im,maculate, beds massive n comfy, hottub huge n warm enough to sit in when the weather is freezing, power shower brilliant. Can't wait for our next visit. PS ledi the dog loved it too n made new friends meeting Charlie n lola x
reviews.title: yellowscott amazing cabins

reviews.text: Although only 10 mins away from my home it's feels like you are miles from anywhere. If you haven't sat in a hot tub with the snow falling on you it's an experience you must indulge in. The tubs are private and away from prying eyes The lodges are amazing and I can't wait till my next visit
reviews.title: Chill time

reviews.text: Brill relaxing break for a few days to get away from it all, peace & quiet no interruptions, friendly reliable staff
reviews.title: Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very welcoming
reviews.title: absolutely perfect

description: Luxury self catering lodges, sleeping 2-10 people, all with private hot tubs. Located in the Fife countryside only 4 miles from Dunfermline.
